numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a clear trend in the graph.
2. In most countries, the percentage of optimistic 15-24-year-olds is higher than the percentage of optimistic 40+-year-olds.
3. Morocco is an exception.
4. In Morocco, the 40+-year-olds are the most optimistic.
5. Nigeria is an exception.
6. In Nigeria, the 40+-year-olds are the most optimistic.
7. India is an exception.
8. In India, the 40+-year-olds are the most optimistic.
9. I wonder why these 3 countries are exceptions.
10. A generational change in world view might explain these exceptions.
11. Political factors might explain these exceptions.
12. Economic factors might explain these exceptions.
13. Cultural factors might explain these exceptions.
14. The US and Ukraine have similar outlooks in the graph.
15. The US and Ukraine are very different countries.
16. I wonder what the US and Ukraine have in common.
17. Some common factor might cause similar percentages in the US and Ukraine.
18. This graph relates to my community.
19. This graph relates to me.
20. My community is a data point in this graph.
21. I am a data point in this graph.
22. This graph can help us understand where our generation stands about the future outlook.
23. This graph can help us understand where our country stands in comparison to other countries.
24. This graph may shorten a generational gap.
25. This graph may help us put ourselves in our elders' shoes.
26. This graph may help us understand the point of view of our elders.
27. This graph compares each country's percentage of optimistic 15-24-year-olds.
28. This graph compares each country's percentage of non-optimistic 40+-year-olds.
29. The title of this graph might be "The Generational Divide".
